S.227
Latest Title: Embassy Security Funds Transfer Act of 2013
Sponsor: Sen Leahy, Patrick J. [VT] (introduced 2/4/2013)      Cosponsors (17)
Latest Major Action: 2/5/2013 Held at the desk.
Jump to: Summary, Major Actions, All Actions, Titles, Cosponsors, Committees, Related Bill Details, Amendments
SUMMARY AS OF:
2/4/2013--Passed Senate without amendment.    (There is 1 other summary)

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Embassy Security Funds Transfer Act of 2013 - Authorizes funds appropriated under the Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 2012 under the headings "Diplomatic and Consular Programs" and "Embassy Security, Construction, and Maintenance" to be transferred between such headings.

MAJOR ACTIONS:

2/4/2013 Introduced in Senate
2/4/2013 Passed/agreed to in Senate: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
2/5/2013 Held at the desk.
ALL ACTIONS:
2/4/2013:
Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S476-477; text as passed Senate: CR S477)
2/5/2013:
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
2/5/2013 12:28pm:
Received in the House.
2/5/2013 1:14pm:
Held at the desk.
TITLE(S):  (italics indicate a title for a portion of a bill)

  • SHORT TITLE(S) AS INTRODUCED:
    Embassy Security Funds Transfer Act of 2013

  • SHORT TITLE(S) AS PASSED SENATE:
    Embassy Security Funds Transfer Act of 2013

  • OFFICIAL TITLE AS INTRODUCED:
    A bill to authorize the transfer of certain funds to improve security at United States embassies and other diplomatic facilities worldwide, and for other purposes.
